org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.observation.transform

Class TransformProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.observation.transform.TransformProcess

  • public class TransformProcess
extends Object
    A TransformProcess will build an Observation from the raw data coming from the environment. Three types of steps are available: 1) A FilterOperation: Used to determine if an observation should be skipped. 2) An Operation: Applies a transform and/or conversion to an observation channel. 3) A DataSetPreProcessor: Applies a DataSetPreProcessor to the observation channel. The data in the channel must be a DataSet. Instances of the three types above can be called in any order. The only requirement is that when build() is called, all channels must be instances of INDArrays or DataSets NOTE: Presently, only single-channels observations are supported.
    Author:
    Alexandre Boulanger

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method will call reset() of all steps implementing ResettableOperation in the transform process.

      • transform

        public Observation transform(Map<String,Object> channelsData,
                             int currentObservationStep,
                             boolean isFinalObservation)
        Transforms the channel data into an Observation or a skipped observation depending on the specific steps in the transform process.
        Parameters:
        channelsData - A Map that maps the channel name to its data.
        currentObservationStep - The observation's step number within the episode.
        isFinalObservation - True if the observation is the last of the episode.
        Returns:
        An observation (may be a skipped observation)

      • builder

        public static TransformProcess.Builder builder()
        Returns:
        An instance of a builder
